intro: Terniola pulchella, commonly known as the beautiful terniola, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Terniola pulchella is typically found in wetlands and along the edges of freshwater bodies, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
